text:
ant.bat tries to execute the command:

java.exe  -classpath "C:\apache-ant-1.6.5\lib\ant-launcher.jar" "-
Dant.home=C:\apache-ant-1.6.5\" org.apache.tools.ant.launch.Launcher

This does not work on my computer with java 1.5.0_09 due to "-character is 
placed before -Dant.home=

Possible solution is to change all 5 occurances of

   "-Dant.home=%ANT_HOME%"

to

   -Dant.home="%ANT_HOME%"

in ant.bat
creator: stefannorgren@yahoo.se
stevel@apache.org
text:
what is your value of ANT_HOME? Does it have a trailing \ ? delete that and see
what happens

creator: peterreilly@apache.org
text: The ant 1.7.0 manual will have the following quote: The ant.bat script makes use of three environment variables - ANT_HOME, CLASSPATH and JAVA_HOME. Ensure that if these variables are set, they do not have quotes (either ' or ") and they do not end with \ or with /. *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 26947 ***
